Rippling abs and sculpted toosh are just part and parcel of this fine specimen.  Hench, I like to indulge in a little fried tempura every now and again.  

Alright, I tend to like a little tempura with sashimi.  It's because these are two things that I generally cannot do at home.  I do not posses the skill necessary to slice sashimi.  Instead, my knife work rivals that of Jack the Ripper.  Or a bald eagle.  And I do not posses a fry-a-lator (and please stop offering to buy me one for your birthday).  

On a sunday night that was neither too cold nor warm, I met up with Val at this place.  And since one of us was on a diet, the other one felt bad about ordering tempura.  Instead I got the seafood sunomono salad and the chirashi dinner entree.  Val got the rainbow roll, miso soup and edamame.  

Seafood sunomono - tart, delicious, correct cucumber usage.  This salad should be made with persian cucumbers or english cucumbers, not the fat, bloated american things that have tough, waxy peels and warts.  The seafood presented was plentiful, wide in variety and tender in texture.  It was $5.

Chirashi dinner - came with soup.  It had lots of fish.  I've started this stupid habit of eating before I go out for food.  I will eat an orange, a pear, a bell pepper.  And a liter of water.  Which means that when I arrived for dinner, I was not exactly hungry anymore.  The chirashi was no YuZen.  But the serving was large.  The fish was wide in variety.  There was a lot of tamago.  And the fish was sliced rather thick.  Sashimi style.  I brought it home for dinner the next day.  It was $14.  

The place did a lot more business in delivery, with many black-clad men scurrying in and out with plastic bags.  They had a plentiful yakitori menu but I was too unhungry to try it.
author: Christina C.

description:
We've passed by Sushi Shoh a number of times now since it opened a few months ago and I've been curious to try it.  It was fairly empty when we got there, which was a little alarming, but it's probably because it just opened, it was a Sunday night, and in grand San Francisco tradition, it was DAMN cold.

After perusing through the large selection of tapas, sushi, entrees and rolls, we decided on the hama hama roll (baked hamachi with gobo and spicy mayo), a spicy tuna roll, and the lobster flower.  

We were quite pleased with our selections.  They were each fresh,  flavorful, and pleasing to the palate.  The hama hama was perfectly crunchy and spicy, and the lobster flower had a nice balance of tuna and lobster such that neither flavor was overpowering.  I love a good spicy tuna, and Sushi Shoh did not disappoint. We were also pleasantly surprised by the free miso soup and edimame that we received before our meal - I didn't realize sushi restaurants still did this.

We ordered the fried banana and ice cream for dessert and loved it!  A word of caution: they use wasabi to stick the ice cream dish to the plate, so don't pull a Julie and curiously try some on a spoon.  That was not the best way to start dessert.  

Takeaway: DO go expecting decent sushi at decent prices with great service.  Don't go expecting a wonderful ambiance and fine decor.  Sushi Shoh is a pretty standard sushi restaurant in that regard, so probably not the best first date spot.
author: Julie S.

description:
just finished my delivery dinner.
I ordered Hamachi Sashimi (5pcs) + Chirashi Don + Sweet Gum (veggie tempura roll) 

Pro: 
timely. I ordered my delivery via Eat24hours. Clear and simple online order website.
Sweet Gum is delicious. I asked for special adding more avocado and tobiko on top.  Tempura veggie are fresh and crisp inside the roll.  lots of avocado and tobiko are also what I love.

Con:
Lack of freshness. the salmon in chirashi is bad and chewy because the tendon or membrane?? anyway, it's hard to chew. I throw all salmon away :(
Shiso leaves are soft and saggy.  so not fresh.  


don't want to order any sashimi raw fish anymore.  If there is a next visit, I will only order cooked dishes.
author: JustinE Y.

description:
This place is a dream come true. I've been 3 times in 2 weeks - which is a lot. We aren't regulars anywhere.

First time I ordered take out teriyaki chicken, just to be safe.  The salad was crisp with a very nice dressing.  The chicken was excellent.

Second and third time we got a combination of rolls and dinner plates (kobe beef teriyaki then tonkatsu.)  Each time the food has been excellent.  The rice is perfect.  The fish is fresh.  Their spicy scallop is just right.

The service is great.  Very nice people and very attentive waitress.  

And oh yeah, $2 pints of Sapporo! 

While we never get a spot in the lot, we always find something on Dewey.  Worst case - keep going on Dewey, turn right on Pacheco, and then 1st right on Magellan. Park just after Sola Ave. There's a path down to the Forest Hill Muni station, which gets you very close to the restaurant.
author: Kylie K.

description:
A group of ravenous friends and I ordered delivery from here on a Monday night. The woman on the phone said it would arrive in about 45 minutes - 1 hour. Okay, we could wait. Let's just throw on a couple of episodes of Arrested Development.....4 episodes later (2.5 hours after we ordered), we FINALLY got our food. 

 I can't really comment on the quality of food since we basically snatched the food out of the delivery guy's hands and devoured all our food in milliseconds. But, from what I remember it wasn't too bad, but not great either.
author: Eme L.

description: This is going to be short and sweet!!!! This place is the bomb!!!!! Love it!!!!!!! Michelle talks of the great Yakatori but I LOVE the sushi, I have had good sushi and this place is def. up in my top 10 places. And the delivery rocks - quick and great packaged food hot if suppose to be and cold if a cold type of dish, serving sizes are great. Lion King roll is awesome, Ice cream for desert.  yummmm. it's ALL GREAT,  Thank Sushi Shoh for ALWAYS being the best.
author: Steve D.

description: Fresh sushi, yummy & Japanese cuisine in my neighborhood, fairly priced & delivered to my door within an hour! Fantastic!
author: Maria T.

description:
Sushi was delicious! However, time was not on their side.  Apparently overrun with takeout orders at 6:30 on a Tuesday night, Sushi Shoh had a difficult time filling our order of 3 rolls and one appetizer. 
Ordered Ankimo, Crystal Water, Lion King, and Spice Bazaar.  All rolls were delicious, especially the Crystal Water...very fresh. Other two were warm rolls; a tastiness that that could appeal to many flavor palates. Ankimo (the APPETIZER) came last...cold..in a margarita glass served with dipping sauce by side. Good quality but have had better. 

In short; they deny you yummy menu items and substitute roll components to give you the freshest fish available; can't hate on that. Time could be an issue, but also super courteous wait staff and food makes the wait a little easier. Definitely try, apparently popular for pick up.
author: Julie O.

description: Ordered delivery, came to us quite promptly. Delicious rolls and sashimi. We got a online ordering deal for a freebie california rolls, and even though it was free it tasted like real crab instead of surimi. The rolls were all delicious - our favourite was the flaming torch roll.
author: johnson c.

description: This is my go-to on Grubhub when I am looking for sushi. They have wonderful rolls, and their deliveries are always on time. The Lion King roll is by far my favorite.
author: T M.

description:
really good neighborhood Japanese restaurant.  The food is good (and I'm Japanese!), the staff are consistently nice, and the place is reasonably priced.   Best of all, it's kid-friendly.  The other night we went there and the waitress saw my child fumbling with chopsticks so she brought over some training chop sticks.  They always give us free edamame too.  

great chicken Katsu; tempura; vegetable soba; and vegetarian rolls.  
Oishii desu ne!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
The fish just wasn't up to par. We went hoping this could become our new local spot for a sushi fix, but ended up crossing it off the list.

We ordered nigiri escolar, mackerel, and scallops. The scallops were good, the other two only mediocre.

We also tried the miso-glazed gindara (black cod), which is grilled. What we received was most definitely *not* gindara. It was some other white fish with a totally different texture and flavor. 

The service was fast and cheerful, but it just doesn't make up for the low quality of the food. In the future we'll be going back to Koo or Ariake instead.
author: Tabitha Y.

description:
I'm always skeptical when a new place opens up, especially new sushi restaurants. As you all know there are TONS and TONS of sushi joints to go to, and a lot of them are not good to just okay. Despite preconceived negative notions of this place, it actually delivers pretty good sushi. When judging sushi I go based on 2 criteria, 1st: taste, and 2nd: originality.

Taste: 3.5-4 STARS, crunchy rolls are crunchy and not oily. avocado is fresh, rice is pretty good.

Originality: 3-4 STARS, they have the usual california rolls and spicy tuna rolls, but they have a couple that are unique and deliver on taste.
author: Nick C.

description: This place is great, quaint neighborhood spot with a very friendly staff. Nice specials, excellent value. Not sure what others were complaining about,  guess all places can have their off nights. If  you live in the hood and like sushi you've gotta check it out.  For the person who complained about parking there is always ample parking on Woodside.
author: Vince S.

description:
ADDED NOTE:  Just a few hours after writing this review, the person who worked on our table wrote a lovely response showing a sincere interest in making us happy.  I was impressed with her willingness to take responsibility on behalf of the restaurant and to look into my concerns.  This prompts me to raise the rating from two to three stars.

Also, when looking at my review below, please note my concern over the service was actually with the team behind the sushi counter and not really the food server.  I have grown accustomed that the people behind the counter often set the tone for the restaurant with warm greetings and so forth.  To be fair, I now understand from the response letter that they had an unusually high volume of delivery orders.  (I can understand that as the food is truly very good.)

Based on the response, I will be sure to come back!

When Sushi Shoh was about to open, I would peek into the restaurant  through the plate glass windows with great anticipation.  As they were ramping up for the opening I sensed they were taking care to create a pleasing, even zen environment.  They put in very nice lighting fixtures and a pretty window with bamboo etchings on the glass.  

I will start with the positives, and it really is a positive- the food quality.
We had sashimi for two and yakitori for two, and both were very good.  The quality of the fish was very good, and the yakitori was nicely prepared, except for the beef which was slightly overcooked.

Now for the disaapointments:

The placement of an unnecessary flat screen tv with sports playing dampens the potential to make it a pleasant dining spot.  There is something about the flickering lights from television that cheapens the atmosphere of a restaurant- especially a small one.  It almost felt like its placement was for the entertainment of the people working there.

Another thing they did was they took the lovely glass they put up for the restaurant and cheapened it with scotch taping menus and other announcements which makes it feel like a low end restaurant though the prices are moderately high.

The other challenge is it seems like no thought was placed on service warmth or style.  There was an almost sluggish disinterest in whether we were enjoying our experience.  I have grown accustomed to the warm greeting and send off that often comes with dining in a nice Japanese restaurant.  Here, eventhough only two other tables were occupied we left without even being noticed or thanked.  

Bottom line- I like the food but would consider travelling farther from home to avoid the lack of warmth and a blah atmosphere. 

I think this restaurant has very good potential if they work on these items.
author: Emanuel B.

description: Still great place for delivery haven't stopped in yet but the delivery is always fast fresh and hot. So far I've tried a lot of their menu and have only had one thing that I didn't like. The Nigiri is always fresh and isn't fishy, ton katsu is great, and salmon or beef terriyaki!
author: Ashley K.

description: .San Francisco seems to lack that perfect combination of a decent Japanese restaurant at a reasonable price.  Sushi Shoh is close by and we pass it often enough that we decided to try it out with low expectations.  We have been there on several occasions and I suppose we think it is worthy of return visits, it just lacks that missing ingredient that draws you back in without even thinking about it.  Granted, we have only tried the combination dinners and some of the sushi.  Prices are reasonable and you will go away more or less satisfied.  But the wow to value ratio is just average.
author: barry a.

description: I love my neighborhood Sushi place!  Great quality, friendly staff.
author: Amanda P.

description: Don't do it. This place is garbage. They are completely disorganized, provide no customer service and the food is inedible. Go to Fuji on West Portal instead.
author: Marivic T.

description: GF and I tried this place out as we were in the neighborhood.  The sushi didnt really impress me and there wasnt anything different then the other sushi places.  They dont serve brown rice with the sushi... but.. the dinner was worth it.  We had Chicken katsu, or was it Tonkatsu? not sure but either way it was good tasting and a good portion.  The service was decent and its a nice quaint place, I may have to come back and try again.
author: ed c.

description: Love this place...close to home plus they deliver.  Free rolls when you spend a certain amount and the sushi is fresh.
author: Dawn D.

description: I order from GrubHub a lot... Of all the places I have ordered food delivered, THIS place was one of the most overpriced. The food wasnt bad, it was merely unremarkable. What WAS remarkable was that we spent $40 for 2 people (incuding tip) and we were hungry when we finished the paultry servings that were provided. We ordered sushi, some skewers and an appetizer. Never again. There are other way better choices!
author: Will G.

description: Their delivery service rocks, especially if you call early. They usually arrive within 30 minutes. The dinner entrees are big portions, the sushi rolls are smaller. My favorites are the unagi and salmon teriyaki entrees. They come with miso and a salad.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great neighborhood spot.  Super friendly without hovering, delish grilled shishinto peppers and generous portions (gave us extra sashimi on a slow night).  Not the trendiest or most authentic place in the city, but not trying to be either.  Good stuff.
author: M L.

description: I really liked the menu, which was a well balanced mix of sushi and other Japanese tastiness. I highly recommend the bacon wrapped scallops, but everything was great down to the vegetables they served with the chicken katsu. Although I didn't have room for the sushi the fried bananas had a tempura batter that was teh noms. Good food, nice decor, and still really affordable. It's kind of hidden away behind Twin Peaks but it's well worth the trip for the best Japanese I've had in the City so far. I feel so lucky to have been the last customer of their first day. I missed the banner out front that said "Grand Opening" and I was surprised when I didn't see them on Yelp yet. If it's this good now I can't wait to see what it's like when they hit their groove, but don't wait cause once it's discovered this place is going to be packed. Will definitely be going back.
author: Jesse H.

description: Had some sushi delivered the other night and had to say it was pretty darn good! Saved over night pretty well too for some left over lunch the next day. Decently priced and they have specials that are cheaper too. The only thing that bothered me was that I ordered a seaweed salad and it came in a tiny container which wasn't even half full. It felt more like a sample than an actual side, kinda disappointing, but otherwise good.
author: Jenelle H.

description:
I went to Sushi Shoh when it first opened, the waitress recommended the Tuna Poki, I was thinking what's the difference between Spicy Tuna roll and the Tuna Poki. It was our appetizer and it looks gorgeous and its cubic shape makes it look so cute actually (sound awkward when describing a dish,^^). It was delicious, fresh and tasty.....even my friend who doesn't like eating raw fish loves it. 

After trying that, we got another appetizer, I forgot what the name is, but is like some squid with wasabi served on the ice, it's so great. I was kinda surprised that I would be able to have these dishes I have never tried before in this new Japanese restaurant. 
We ordered the spider roll, california roll, Tamago nigiri, Uni nigiri, Beef Tarayaki and lamb rack

They are good, especially the beef tarayaki and lamb rack it was amazingly  delicious, even better than some famous steak house.

Tamago is wrapped in a really fancy way....I love it. I guess the Sushi Chief is an expert. Just love their stuff

Now they offer delivery, its even better
Just ordered yesterday, they delivered in 15 mins which is way faster than what they have suggested (45 mins). Nice packing ......I love it!
They are the best!! :P
author: Chun Him L.

description: I want very much to like this restaurant: it's conveniently located down the street from my apartment, the decor is modern and fashionable and the service is very friendly. My boyfriend and I stopped in for a  quick bite before a movie and ended up waiting over an hour for one sashimi combi, one unagi nigiri and two rolls. We inquired about the order after we noticed that tables seated after us had already been served their food and the waitress apologized and promised to bring out the order quickly. The sushi rice was completely overcooked, soggy, condensed mush although the sashimi was fresh and tasted just fine. I hope that as a new restaurant they are working out their kinks and that when I try them again the rice will have improved but for now I'd rather wait outside Tekka or Okina for my sushi.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Sushi delivery, not many. Tried Sushi Shoh, was delish. For comparison, tried Takara Sushi SF, wasnt impressed at all. When in Noe and looking for sushi delivery, Sushi Shoh wins hands down. When in the marina, Enoshima is my spot!
author: sarah c.

description: How lucky we are that this wonderful japanese restaurant opened up right in our neighborhood.  Food is great, love the steak teriyaki and the salmon teriyaki!  Sushi is tasty and fresh.  Portions are good for the price. I've eaten here alone and with up to a party of five and they are always accommodating.  We have been back several times and the food quality and good service have been consistently great.  It is sometimes empty because they deliver too, but I would rather eat there because it is a real comfortable, clean place and it's still easy to get a table.    Even if I lived across town I would take the drive to eat here, it's a great spot!
author: Felicia V.

description: This place is excellent.  I'm very happy that a sushi restaurant has opened here in the neighborhood.  The fish was fresh and tasty; the service was attentive and they kept trying to give us free stuff.
author: Jorm ..

description: This order is for delivery.  I ordered the crunchy spicy tuna and spice bazaar rolls.  The rolls were okay but pretty soggy and not crunchy.  For this price, I won't order delivery again.  I will give them one more chance to see how the food is at dine in.
author: C L.

description: Great sushi. Rolls are huge, pretty, and delicious! Seaweed salad is crunchy and tasty. Prices are great. Service is super fast and friendly.The server even asked someone smoking right outside the door to move for me. Their fried banana dessert is one of the best I've had too! Small restaurant but I always find a table no problem. They just need some background music and it would be perfect.
author: Casai D.

description: Delivery always on time. Probably the best sushi place that delivers. I love the Lion King roll and the crunchy California roll. Sooooooo good!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Sushi Shoh is located in a little shopping center that people walk by on the way home from Forest Hill Station. With the exception of Chouchou and Kathy's, which has a lot of regulars, it has always been tough for the third restaurant in this five store shopping center. There was a Mexican restaurant that seemed promising but I did not have a chance to try it before Sushi Shoh took its place. 

One exciting thing about Sushi Shoh is that they offer yakitori, which is lacking in the bay area, even if you count the San Jose region. So I ordered the Yakitori Moriwase (combo) and my husband ordered the Chirashi dinner. The yakitori was six skewers chef's choice and they gave us: Butaniku Yaki, Gyu Hire Yaki, shishito, shitake, Namajake Sumiyaki, and Tebasaki. They were all good but not great in comparison to a specialized yakitori restaurant. It was mentioned on the menu that they use real Japanese charcoal, which is great, because it imparts a different flavor than regular American charcoal. 

We knew right away when we walked in that this was a Chinese owned and operated Japanese restaurant and that was fine by us. We eat a lot of great Japanese food, from Japanese restaurants that are owned and operated by Japanese, to others that are Japanese owned but have a lot of Chinese cooks/staff, and this would fall into the third category, Japanese restaurants owned and operated by Chinese folk. It may seem petty if you do not eat Japanese food often but there are nuances. And of course, you really have to try it before you judge. Not all Japanese owned restaurants are great and Chinese owned places medicore. One thing you will find is that Japanese places tend to have a higher grade of fish, better knife execution, better tea and being Japanese, also smaller portions and higher prices. Sushi Shoh, like other good Chinese sushi joints we have been too, had good sushi quality and nice fat pieces. Everything was creamy, fresh, and cut well enough that you did not bite into ligaments that can make the fish chewy. Someone did mention they had a lot of "fakesushi" on the menu and that pretty much means rolls. Rolls are generally more emphasized at Chinese owned places than Japanese ones. We also ordered a salmon skin roll which was decent as well. 

So the next time we feel like some good, decently affordable sushi near our house we will come here. If we want sashimi focused places there are other Japanese joints available in the city. Someone also wrote that the decor was sparse but I found it to be pretty nice for a casual spot.
author: Empress C.

description: Great Services! Great Food!! The owner is very creative! I like how they put the desserts! Go TRY IT! I will sure go back again and again!!
author: Tammy V.

description: My husband and I came here very recently and loved it.  The service was great, and the yakitori, which I have never eaten before, was wonderful.  I would most definitely come back here.  I agree with one of the reviews about ditching the big screen TV though.
author: Prabha M.

description: Recently visited again. They're slipping. Quality isn't as good and freshness just isn't what I'd like. There's still time, guys. Pick it up a little or else you'll risk losing us for good.
author: Al M.

description: Lovely staff- food was ok.  The CA roll is made with imitation crab meat- you can get real for $2.00 but it is not listed on the menu.  I would have rather paid for the real!!!  Sushi rolls are fresh, but they shouldn't sear the fish on top of the rolls.  The fried bananas and sesame ice cream were to die for!!!!
author: David R.

description: Super fast and fresh delivery! Sushi Shoh has saved me from standing in those 2 hour lines at other sushi places. Have you tried the Lion King roll? If you haven't, you really should.
author: Emily W.

description:
This place is awesome for delivery. I've never dined in as I'm always with my kid and he refuses to eat any type of asian food. So, I've tried more than half their menu and nearly everything has been really good. 
The highlights, their specialty rolls are all very good, right now I'm a fan of the firebomb. Their udon nebeyaki is super delish, I love the poached egg and huge pieces of chicken. I didn't like their chicken terriaki too much, but I love love love their steak terriaki. It's not a bunch of tiny shaved beef strips I've had other places. It's a full on thin cut of rib eye. The only way it could be better is if they shaved the extra fat off for you, but it is always tender and perfectly cooked. Their tempura is pretty crispy for delivery and there is always a great variety of veggies.
So if you are looking for a good sushi delivery place, this place is the bomb. The only reason why it's not five stars is because their fish could be a little fresher.
author: Lisa B.

description: what a great sushi restaurant. came here recommended by a friend and glad that we did. The decor was very modern and clean. Food was great too. Had the tofu specialty which was soft inside and light crunch outside- sauce was yummy. tempera udon was really tasty and lots of different type of tempura. My son loved it. Hubby got the steak teriyaki- it was a huge portion and again very tasty. Order few different type of raw fishes and they were very fresh. Service was great and they were very accommodating to our 3 year old. And they deliver!!!! We need some more delivery restaurants in Seattle. Oh- did I mention that this place was far better than places we went in japantown where we were staying?
author: Shy z.

description: My new favorite sushi place!! I've eaten from here twice and each time was very enjoyable!! This is the cutest little restaurant and the service is great!! The people are really nice, and they're always giving out free samples when you eat in!! What I like about this place is that they have these sushi rolls that sound like strange combinations, but they taste amazing!! My favorites are the crystal water roll, and the lobster flower roll. they both have really unique tastes. Last night, I got the steak teriyaki to go and it was delicious!!! Oh and they have delivery!! How cool is that?! I've never heard of a sushi place that delivers!!!
author: S M.

description: Service was great, sushi was good. Stand out was the tofu. Caters to the west of twin peaks crowd.
author: James M.

description: Tried going back there yesterday but it was closed because of a private party.  Ate there when they first opened and the service was great.  The sushi was fresh and had a somewhat good variety.  Will head back to give it another try.
author: Mary L.

description: My family and I came here for dinner recently and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of food here. I loved the Evergreen roll and my husband enjoyed the chicken meatballs and several other tapas dishes.The waitstaff is very nice, although a bit slow at time. The restaurant is tiny but very comfortable and charming. I am looking forward to coming back and trying some more things.
author: Keromi K.

description: Food is great. Charcoal flown in from Japan gives the Yakitori an unique flavor. Their scallops are also a must try !!!
author: John P.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by this sushi restaurant.  The fish was high quality and tasty.
author: Anne F.
